SEARCH
Package gridgames

Interface GameInput

All Known Implementing Classes:
CLI, MouseInput
public interface GameInput
Interface for classes which gather user's input for the GameController class.

This interface allows a GameController instance to manipulate a Game object without knowing the implementation required to actually gather the user's inputs. Thus the GameController has an attribute implementing this interface which tranlsate the actual user's inputs in a form of events that it can recognize, for most of its methods.

This events mechanism relies on the EventType enuerations.

See Also:
  • EventType
  • GameController

  • Method Details

    • waitAck

      void waitAck()
      Requests the user to confirm something. E.g. confirm the reading of a displayed message.

    • getMessage

      String getMessage(EventType e)
      Returns a String corresponding to a message this GameInput associates to a given EventType. E.g. a dialog to display when the user must make a choice between different options.
      Parameters:
      e - An input event type as an EventType enumeration.
      Returns:
      A String associated with the EventType.

    • getEventType

      EventType getEventType()
      Returns an event type EventType enumeration triggered by a user's input.

      This method must not return null if SwingIntegrated IS NOT implemented by this GameInput instance.

      Returns:
      An EventType enumeration derived from a user's input.
      See Also:
      • SwingIntegrated

    • getDifficulty

      Difficulty getDifficulty()
      Returns a level of difficulty Difficulty enumeration choosen by the user.

      This method must not return null if SwingIntegrated IS NOT implemented by this GameInput instance.

      Returns:
      A level of difficulty as Difficulty enumeration.
      See Also:
      • SwingIntegrated

    • getCoordinates

      int[] getCoordinates()
      Returns coordinates of the user's selection as an array of two int. These coordinates need to be returned as follows: 
       return new int[] {row, col};
      Where row is the row index of the Grid from a Game instance, and col is the column index of the Grid from a Game instance.

      This method must not return null if SwingIntegrated IS NOT implemented by this GameInput instance.

      Returns:
      Coordinates of the user's selection as an int[].
      See Also:
      • SwingIntegrated

    • getMouseCoordinates

      int[] getMouseCoordinates(MouseEvent e)
      Returns mouse coordinates of the user's selection as an array of two int. These coordinates need to be returned as follows: 
       return new int[] {x, y};
      Where x is the horizontal position of the event relative to the mouse and y is the vertical position of the event relative to the mouse.
      Parameters:
      e - A MouseEvent triggered by the user with a mouse.
      Returns:
      Coordinates of the user's selection as an int[].
      See Also:
      • SwingIntegrated

    • makeButton

      JButton makeButton(String text)
      Creates a new JButton button object with a text on it. If the implentation is not needed, this method can return null.
      Parameters:
      text - String parameter to display on the button.
      Returns:
      A newly allocated JButton object.

    • makeToggleButton

      JToggleButton makeToggleButton(String text)
      Creates a new JToggleButton button object with a text on it. If the implentation is not needed, this method can return null.
      Parameters:
      text - String parameter to display on the button.
      Returns:
      A newly allocated JToggleButton object.

    • makeComboBox

      JComboBox<String> makeComboBox(String[] items)
      Creates a new JComboBox<String> combo-box object with a list of option labels. If the implentation is not needed, this method can return null.
      Parameters:
      items - String[] containing labels for the different options.
      Returns:
      A newly allocated JComboBox<String> object.

    • makeTextArea

      JTextArea makeTextArea(int nRow, int nCol)
      Creates a new JTextArea text area object with the specified parameters. If the implentation is not needed, this method can return null.
      Parameters:
      nRow - Number of rows for the text area, as an int.
      nCol - Number of columns for the text area, as an int.
      Returns:
      A newly allocated JTextArea object.

    • makeInfoDialog

      JDialog makeInfoDialog(String title, String text)
      Creates a new JDialog dialog window object with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      title - Title of the dialog window as a String.
      text - Text to display on the dialog window as a String.
      Returns:
      A newly allocated JDialog object.

    • showTwoChoicesDialog

      void showTwoChoicesDialog(String title, String text, String[] options, Runnable onFirstOption, Runnable onSecondOption)
      Brings up a two-choices dialog set with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      title - Title of the dialog as a String.
      text - Main text to display on the dialog as a String.
      options - List of option labels as a String[].
      onFirstOption - Operation associated with the first option as a Runnable.
      onSecondOption - Operation associated with the second option as a Runnable.
